Articles.Content:
Yes but these will actually be able to go underwater as we are currently working on removing the camera block that stops you from being able to see underwater. As well as a few other things.

Ping! Ping! Ping! Sonar, I hope? Submarine navigation entirely via instruments and IVA could be a challenge in and of itself.

The Lazer mod lends itself well to a periscope, btw.
Could we have ballistic missile subs? Or even SM-3 armed subs.
Who said anything about arming submarines? We haven't made anything that "IS" a weapon at all yet we have made ships that carry weapons but we have made nothing weaponized ourselves.

Who said anything about arming submarines? We haven't made anything that "IS" a weapon at all yet we have made ships that carry weapons but we have made nothing weaponized ourselves.

'tis true, you haven't made weapons yet. You just gleefully give us the hulls and we fill them up to the brim with both cobbled together and purpose built munitions. And I bet you guys get a laugh out of just how overboard we go on the armaments, no?
I do have vanguard
I will PM you with my skype address give me a call and I will work with you one on one to fix your problem. Ok?
I have a question: will the subs have crush depths?

I have a question: will the subs have crush depths?

Good point, but I hope not, as I'll be busily colonizing the ocean bottom if there isn't any crush depth.
Probably not as that is just another thing that we will have to create with coding but we still have no idea what our limit for the code will be.
Btw InfiniteDice and I have to chat tonight but we are getting very close to release guys so stay tuned! (As we were working slowly to release but basically we were waiting until 0.20)

thats a great idea

when i get this im going to make a secret under water base right away and then BLOW IT UP
Prepare for an underwater Kerbals at War video.

I'm going to see if I can get a wildly improbable underwater base to Laythe without cheats. I wonder if theres a way to make it so that Kerbalnauts can actually stay at the bottom and not immediately shoot up and die....
I can't wait till all the mods update.

I've pulled the mod from spaceport till I have the time to go over it, no point having people download it while it's broken. I may wait till R3 is done, which is still moving forward on a daily basis. It'll be done when it's done!

Hey Guys, seems the thread is a total loss. I have some historic photos showing the evolution of the mod, I'll upload those and try to re-create this opening thread from memory when I get the chance.

For new visitors:

1) Download from SpacePort HERE

2) Download this little fix file and overwrite where needed. LATEST FIX

3) Make sure you have the Vanguard Plugin - this is still required until I release R3.

OPTIONAL: Deadbeef's hangar expansion mod... not needed but makes editing the carrier in the SPH much easier! Get it here

I will continue to restore information as I get the time.

See dice's post above yours

See dice's post above yours

Thanks Capt.

To be sure, progress is being made. Like harvesters note regarding development, things get slower the further along you get. More things added means more things to double check, since things may interact differently under various situations.

Just when you think you have everything sorted out, something tends to come back and bite when you least expect it.

Just so you guys can have an idea of what I've been up to...

From the very beginning Boat parts have had a few issues. 1) lag - ships are large, this means usually having many parts to build one. This is why stock part boats suck, and the reason for my creating Boat Parts in the first place. 2) world interaction - Boats don't fly, boats don't usually fall apart easily unless you are talking about racing boats, or wooden boats. Making ships not fly in KSP is a challenge as we all know that things get really strange and floaty at times. Further to this is the fact that water doesn't really behave like water in the game. Yes parts float on it... but you can toss any fluid dynamics out the window.

Trial and error is essentially what it takes to find solutions (workarounds) to some of these issues. I've spent crazy time on this and it's coming along.

The one issue I had was with the ship hitting land and flying up into the air. This has been solved for the most part, not saying it can't happen but it should be now greatly reduced.

Another issue was controlling floatation, not only is this needed for load leveling, but also for damage, and damage control simulation (for later). Now I have a ship which we can balance each section to float exactly how we want. Goodbye splashing parts! Goodbye lag!

The current carrier I'm testing with is the KCVN Grasshopper Mk2, it's still large and can easily hold more than enough aircraft. It can move at 40+ m/s at 4x warp, without any deformation, wobble, or splashing. Only slight load leveling and trim setting is needed and it's pretty much 'hands free' right across the ocean.

Since summer is upon me, that means reduced computer time. Some days I can get 8 hours in, some days nothing. On average perhaps 2 hours a night now for mod development. Since R3 is so close to being finished, and I really want everyone to have it, I'm considering scaling back a few of the 'bonus' stuff I had planned and stick to the basics. To get this done I need about 5 textures made and some models tweaked.

So when it's done it's done, but I really want to get this out sooner before summer eats up all my time.

Later guys! I will post some pics tonight.
Will Ferram Aerospace affect any of the crafts?
They are boats and they craft will probably not fly if you have ferram aerospace installed.

Thanks Capt.
